I have a few peeves that are somewhat related and boil down to the same thing -- being treated as criminal rather than as a valued customer at businesses.
 
 1. I absolutely refuse to pay before pumping gas into a vehicle. I will drive 20 miles and pay twice as much if I have to. As soon as that speaker crackles "pump number eight, you must pay before pumping", I screw the gas cap back on, flip them the bird and drive away. And, you can be damn sure I will never stop at that station ever again. If there comes a time when there is no gas station left in America where I cannot walk in and pay for my gas AFTER filling the tank - I will walk or ride my bicycle.
 
 In that case I would take the bus but they want payment before service as well. emoticon_angry
